_comment: Created by EFisher on 12/10/2015 14:31:20 using v2.7
title: How has the proportion of category A calls attended within 19 minutes changed?
analysis_commentary:
The Government requires that when onward patient transport is required in a life threatening situation an ambulance should arrive on scene within 19 minutes.

As with the eight-minute target, there has been a steady decline between 2011 and 2017 in the proportion of Category A calls with an ambulance on scene within 19 minutes. In particular, there has been deterioration in performance across all regions since March 2014. London was consistently and clearly the best performing region until March 2014. This was followed by a substantial drop in performance, falling below 85% in December 2014. Performance did recover after this, however performance is currently below target as of January 2017 (91%). No region has met the 95% target since June 2015.

Updated March 2017.
data_source: NHS England, Ambulance Quality Indicators: System Indicators
